intro: Lindenia rivalis, commonly known as the slender lindenia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a smooth margin and a soft, velvety texture. Lindenia rivalis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
